pkgmetadata.longdescription: NTPClient is an NTP client for UNIX-like systems, RFC 1305 and RFC 4330. Its functionality is a small subset of ntpd, chrony, OpenNTPd, and xntpd. Since it is much smaller, it is also more relevant for embedded systems in need of only a client.

use.flag: Enable analysis code path and debugging of NTP protocol.
Build a very small ntpclient, from OpenWRT project.
Enable obsolete features, to use with kernel versions older than 3.0
Enable logging to syslog instead of logging to stderr.
